ygData.subject: Re: NEAT Feed Foward Network

Thanks Wesley!  I did convert over to SharpNEAT 2.  I noticed there is no l=
onger an option to disable pruning, might you know how to do this?

--- In =
neat@yahoogroups.com, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Chris,
> 
> =
I'm assuming you're using SharpNEAT 2, correct?
> 
> The CreateGenomeList m=
ethod has an overload which takes a seed genome.
> Genomes are stored to di=
sk as XML files which you can create/edit by hand if
> you want. You can lo=
ad a fixed-topology genome from file (see
> NeatGenomeXmlIO) and then pass =
it to that method as a seed. Then just change
> the reference in your INeat=
Experiment implementation to use your new
> CreateEvolutionAlgorithm.
> 
> =
You'll also want to edit your NeatGenomeParameters to set
> AddNodeMutation=
Probability, AddConnectionMutationProbability,
> DeleteConnectionMutationPr=
obability, and
> DeleteSimpleNeuronMutationProbability equal to 0.
> 
> If =
you're using SharpNEAT v1, I'd recommend switching to version 2. It's a
> l=
ot more elegantly designed and offers more room for customization and
> ext=
ensibility.
> 
> SharpNEAT 2: https://sites.google.com/site/sharpneat/
> Co=
de is available at the bottom.
> 
> I wrote a couple tutorials on SN2 as we=
ll:
> 
> http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/17/tutorial-evolving-neural-netw=
orks-with-sharpneat-2-part-1/
> http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/24/tutori=
al-%e2%80%93-evolving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-2/
> 
> Hope th=
at helps!
> 
> Wesley
> 
> 
> On Fri, Oct 29, 2010 at 1:22 AM, chris2005hi =
<chrismnu2003@...> wrote:
> 
> >
> >
> > Forgive me if this is a silly ques=
tion, I just started experimenting with
> > NEAT. Is there a way to for Sha=
rpNEAT to start with and evolve only standard
> > feed-forward, single-laye=
r perceptron networks?
> >
> >  
> >
>
